While you are allowed to opt for the pass/fail grading option up to six credits from this semester’s subjects, I would like to make it clear that there may be undesirable consequences for making this choice in future, for example:

- If in future you seek membership of HKIE, they may not consider the subjects that you have passed with pass/fail grading as adequate qualification for membership and may require you undertake additional training or examinations. The Faculty has received this advice from HKIE.
- If you seek admission to higher degrees (such Masters/MPhil/PhD), the institution that you’re seeking admission to may not accept the credits that you have gained using the pass/fail option.
- This is particularly pertinent to subjects that constitute your DSR (discipline specific requirement), so if you do choose the pass/fail option, you may consider choosing non-DSR subjects

I hope this will help you in choosing your options wisely.
